question.text: The most thoroughly studied known bacteria–plant interactions is:

options.text: Plant growth simulation by phosphate-solubilising bacteria
Cyanobacterial symbiosis with some aquatic ferns
Gall formation on certain angiosperms by Agrobacterium
Nodulation of Sesbania stems by nitrogen fixing bacteria

solution.text:
- Agrobacterium tumefaciens is called natural plant genetic engineer. Its interaction with plants is most thoroughly studied amongst the four options given in the question.
- A. tumefaciens is a soil bacterium which causes crown gall tumours in dicotyledonous plants. A gall-producing gene (T DNA) occurs in a large plasmid called tumour inducing (Ti) plasmid.
- Agrobacterium has been used to transfer gene in tobacco plants with increased resistance to TMV.
